snippet: The city said it would track and post on the Web not only contributions and spending by independent groups, but also their ads and information about their backers.
abstract: New York City campaign regulators are girding for a wave of independent spending in local 2013 campaigns, saying interest groups and individuals are watching the super PAC phenomenon in the presidential campaign and preparing to adapt it for local use; city will track and post on the Web not only contributions and spending by independent groups, but also their ads and information about their backers.
lead_paragraph: The city said it would track and post on the Web not only contributions and spending by independent groups, but also their ads and information about their backers.

headline.seo: New York City Regulators Prepare for Super PACs’ Effect on Local Elections
headline.main: In 2013 Races, New York Prepares for ‘Super PAC’ Effect
headline.print_headline: In 2013 Races, New York Prepares for ‘Super PAC’ Effect

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
